body: LEAD: Friday PILAR RIOJA DANCES Friday PILAR RIOJA DANCES Pilar Rioja, renowned for her remarkable repertory of Spanish dance, begins a 15-day engagement tonight at the Repertorio Espanol's Gramercy Arts Theater, at 138 East 27th Street. Miss Rioja - who is considered one of the foremost performers of Spanish flamenco, classical, court and folk
title: GOING OUT GUIDE

body: LEAD: The New York City Board of Estimate is scheduled to vote at today's meeting on new zoning rules aimed at spurring construction of lower and bulkier apartment buildings throughout the city to meet the demand for middle-income housing. title: Vote Planned On New Rules For Low Units

body: LEAD: Folk Art Institute Workshops Folk Art Institute Workshops Museum of American Folk Art, 444 Park Avenue South (30th Street); 212-481-3080. Registration is under way for day and evening classes and workshops that will begin Sept. 8. Four new courses will be offered, including a workshop that will examine the care, conservation and restoration
title: Events; Art Classes and a Brooklyn Tour

body: LEAD: Thomas J. Cuite, who retired in 1985 after 16 years as majority leader of the New York City Council, died of a heart attack yesterday morning at Lutheran Medical Center in Brooklyn. title: THOMAS CUITE DIES OF A HEART ATTACK
